messages.content: “Eh?” I turn towards my barony.
Donald runs in the direction of it,
I also do this.
The others follow. The chaos seems to be occurring in the merchant’s guild.
"Dammit." I head to the merchants guild and ready a weapon.

There is a disgusting looking large worm creature with sharp teeth and strange tentacles rampaging through the guild headquarters and crawling around the walls. It has not noticed Aeolian’s group yet as it feasts on several dead merchants.
“Unfortunate.” I murmur.
Aliza and Theo take out their weapons. Donald takes out a deck of cards for some reason.
Of course. A gamer. I also withdraw my quarterstaff.
Aliza grants Aeolian bardic inspiration. This finally alerts the creature. ((Roll initiative))
((18. I think))
The creature swipes at Aliza with its tentacles and attempts to bite Aeolian. ((What is your AC D&D beyond is being mean))

It hits both, dealing 6 damage to Aeolian. Aliza successfully shrugs off the poison on the tentacles without being affected.
It’s Aeolian’s turn.
I cast Sanctuary on Aliza.

"Disgusting homicidal worm!" Aliza hurts it with 4 psychic damage and inflicts disadvantage on its next attack. Then she casts healing word to give Aeolian 3hp.

Donald pulls out the 12 of hearts from his deck, a card that does not exist. It becomes 12hp that raises him above his current max.

Theo stabs it for 8 damage. 

The creature manages to hit Theo with its tentacles despite the disadvantage and paralyzes him with poison. Theo will have to keep rolling to escape this every turn until he succeeds. It bites at Donald but misses.
It’s Aeolian’s turn.
I attack with my quarterstaff. ((21 nat 20))
It crits.

Aliza stabs it for 2 damage.

Donald takes out an invisible card from his deck. It does nothing.

Theo escapes the effects of the poison. 

The creature attacks Donald and Aeolian, missing both attacks. 

It’s Aeolian’s turn again.
I attack it again.

It misses.

Aliza stabs it with a crit, for 2 damage.

Donald pulls the 4 of shields out of his deck, another fake card. All 4 of them are covered by a shield that raises their AC by 2 until the end of the fight.

The creature hits Donald with a crit, which he fails to escape the poison of. It then narrowly misses its attempt to take a bite out of Theo.

It’s Aeolian’s turn.
I attempt again to attack .
It misses.
Darn.

Aliza stabs it for 2 damage.

Donald remains paralyzed.

Theo stabs it for 5 damage.

The creature passes the wisdom save to hit Aliza but still misses. It successfully bites Theo.

It’s Aeolian’s turn.
Attack. ((19))
It hits.
((One damage.))

Aliza stabs it for 2 damage.

Donald escapes the poison, finally. "Ugh…"

Theo’s attack misses.

The creature’s attacks both miss.

It’s Aeolian’s turn.

It would seem the efficacy of my offensive maneuvers has depreciated; the highly effective attack from earlier is not at all akin to that sorry display just now.

What alerted the creature? What gave it cause to notice us? It was Aliza… Bardic Inspiration. It must detect things via one of sound or magic.

I use Magical Tinkering, imbuing a coin with the property of making an incredibly loud noise, and throw it in a corner further away from us. This plan is brilliant and will work.

> The bark comes before the bite.
- Wazy Emerson
((Roll deception ig))
Indubitably.
((20 not natural))

Aliza stabs it for 2 damage 

Donald retrieves the 5 of confusion. This casts the spell Confusion on everyone around. ((Roll a wisdom saving throw))

Somehow, everyone except the creature is confused.

Theo runs in a random direction and remains confused.

The creature chases after the coin and attempts to find the source of the noise angrily.

Aeolian wastes his turn standing there. ((Roll another wisdom save to get out of this))

“If mankind creates gods itself, then were it not… is it not…” I murmur.

((9))

Theo, in his confusion, successfully stabs the creature for 5 damage. It looks incredibly weak at this point.

Everyone else just kind of stands there.

The creature whacks Theo with its tentacles, paralyzing him, and then biting him down to 0 hp.

Somehow, in Aeolian’s confusion, he manages to have a normal turn anyway.
Mm. This seems important. I cast Spare The Dying on Theo.
((Roll a d20 to see if you can escape the confusion permanently))

Aeolian is no longer confused.

Aliza just runs off in a random direction.

Donald pulls the Ace of Disadvantage, giving the creature disadvantage on all rolls.

Aeolian is hit for 5 damage by a tentacle. ((Roll a constitution saving throw))
Aeolian avoids being paralyzed. It is his turn.
It’s good that I’m not paralyzed. That would be quite the inconvenience on top of having been reduced to 0 HP.
Roll a death saving throw then.

Aliza escapes confusion while running in a random direction.

Donald finally pulls a useful card, the 4 of Lightning. It electrocutes the creature to death.

((End session))

Selle finds somewhere to change, and changes into their new clothes, as well as putting on their blonde wig and using a pocket mirror to apply makeup that would exaggerate their female features more. They, or should I say, she, now has the appearance of an average young lady.

*Skirts really are such a pain to move in. Good things this one seems to be a bit easier...* 

 After this, Selle tries to orientate herself as to how far away she would be from the Soltarian Main Church of the Order of Libra.
They’re near the southwest edge of the city. The temple is around the north end.

*Quite a ways away huh...  I still don't really have a clue as to what my plan for this is. I gather that I've got a bit of a time limit going on, but planning wise, this is tough. My only real contact is technically Laura, but I have bothered her enough and I don't want to bump into any Hellhounds during this process... Hold on, what happened to Erik? I still have hardly a clue who he is, and he kind of just followed me into some of the most dangerous situations, then disappeared yesterday? What a mess...*

Selle is a bit lost. She has no idea what to do regarding Locruz. For now, Selle decides that what matters most is *information*. That's the start of any investigation, after all. Selle tries to recall how the Order of Libra structures it's ceremonies as a religious organisation.
((Uh. Elaborate? Roll religion too though probably))
(( basically asking if they hold mass meetings with it's members and what days etc. i just need more  information on the order of libra generally speaking

The Temple of Libra occasionally hosts ceremonies that are open to the public but there aren’t any around this time. The only people who should be there at the moment are people who either work there or decided to go for their own reasons.

*Get it together, * * * * *  *!* 
*What can I do? The High Priestess is probably someone I'm gonna have to do my best to avoid the most, I'm well aware of just how powerful she is. I wonder If I'd be able to come up with a sort of distraction to get everyone out of the Temple? Is there a way to do this without harming innocent civilians I wonder... I guess, I should just make it over in that general direction first instead of getting lost in thought.*

Selle sets off to travel from the south west side of the city to the north side.
They arrive near the temple of libra. ((Roll perception))
Nothing of note seems to be occurring.

*Brain fog... Doesn't seem to be much going on. That or I'm just out of it.*
Selle sighs, and shakes her head.
*Good thing this outfit is plain, otherwise I'd look conspicious.*
Selle checks the time of day.
It’s a little past noon.

*Sneaking around is a better idea when it's dark. I should find a way to find information that doesn't involve me straight up rocking up into the temple. A library?*
Selle is curious about if a library would contain any archaelogical documents or books regarding the Temple of Libra.
The temple’s layout wouldn’t be much of a secret. ((Roll religion))
There’s a prison cell used for ceremonial purposes in the temple. That’s most likely where they’d keep him.
(sorry, food break. give me a bit)

*A prison cell, huh. Probably being tortured down there. Yeah, definitely only a chance of sneaking into there at night... Although, having been reminded of a recent experience, the royal palace had a section that was open to the catacombs. I should give the idea of something like that for the Temple an inspection at some point as well. The most important part now is to be constantly wary about what time it is.*

Selle checks if there is an entrance into the catacombs anywhere near here.
It is not below ground, since the purpose of the cell is to be displayed. It shouldn’t be too hard to get close as a normal visitor.

*I see, it does seem that way. Maybe I won't have to bother with that at all. Well, in this disguise, I can probably just come in and keep an eye out for certain things.*
Selle walks into the Temple of Libra.
No one questions their entrance.

Selle takes a good look around, particularly, looking for key figures and the cell.
*I ought to go and take a prayer as well, as to not seem suspicious. I'm familiar with the process I was taught in my childhood.*
((Roll investigation))
Selle does not notice anything of note beyond the cell they already knew about, which does seem occupied, though it’s not fully clear by who from this distance.
Selle wonders if it is possible to have the cell be more visible if they move to the prayer area.
It is not.

*It seems like it'll be hard to make out who's in that cell from here, and going to the prayer area won't help with that...*
Selle wonders if it might be possible to come closer to the cell without seeming suspicious, or if that area is used only for special purposes.
That depends on how much you trust your deception skills.

*Can't make any progress without any risks, huh.*
Selle walks closer to inspect the cell, prepared to try to talk her way out of questioning.
Nash Edwardson and his companions from yesterday are guarding the cell Locruz is in.

*...What? Hold on let me catch my thoughts. I'm sorry. What? What? What? Whaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaat?????*
'Elyssa' tries her utmost to contain her shock.
*That's. That's a corpse? That's someone I saw die? What? What? What?*
'Elyssa' is a little dumbfounded.
Nash looks up. "Uh.. hello?" Confused.

'Elyssa', (I will hereby be saying Selle again) catches herself lost in thought and gets her composure back. Her voice is a lot more feminine sounding compared to the last time anyone here heard it.
"Sorry, I'm just a little lost, I'm new to Soltaria, and was looking around a bit. Would you mind being able to tell me what the purposes of some of the areas in this Temple are for? I'd love to give a prayer."
Selle's eyes look towards Locruz in the cell.
Nash shifts, collecting himself. "Do you have any authorization to be here? No offense, ma'am, but this is a serious situation." His voice is kind, or as close to it as he can approximate, anyways.
"Who are you?" The monk.

*Authorisation? I just walked in here. Their security must be really loose...*
"Oh my apologies. My name is Elyssa. I was just able to walk in here, so I assumed it wasn't off-limits, I sincerely apologise if I am being troublesome."
Selle has a kind smile on.
Nash smiles patronizingly. "No, no trouble at all. But I'm afraid we'll most likely have to see you out." He glances at his boss for a moment, as if gauging her response.

*Seems fine...*
"Ah, okay! That is fine. If you could also help me with some directions that would also be awfully helpful of you."
"Where do you want to go?" Archer.
"I would like to find somewhere to make a prayer in the temple."
"Shouldn’t that just be-" The archer goes silent as the high priestess enters the room.

*Oh. Not a good sign. Not good at all.*
Selle notices that the archer has gone silent and pretends to wonder why she is not being escorted out.
"What?" Nash says to the High Priestess, exasperated.
"I heard that the baron came by. Did you l-" She pauses, looking at Selle as her eye begins to glow with the mark of Libra.

*That same eye glow again. I saw that last time. Too damn scary. The last time I learned that it wasn't to do with mind reading, since it didn't affect my ring...*
"Oh, I am so sorry to intrude, these kind individuals were just helping to see me out, as I was quite lost."
Selle attempts to keep her composure and talk through the situation.
"Burr? Yes. Tremendously unpleasant man." Nash pauses when he notices, uh.. whatever it is that Harriet's doing.

"You." She takes out her rapier. "You attacked the emperor. You did this. You 3, arrest her." Harriet.

"Huh!? What?" The archer sims his bow at Selle.

*Oh, shit? Really? You fucking moron, Nash, did you not realize something was wrong the second you looked at her? Idiot..! Too obsessed with showing off, preening yourself in public! She'll have your head for this, and she'll deserve it..!*
Nash draws his longsword and points it at her threateningly.

*She sees through the disguise? Wait, hold on, she's saying what the Queen told me the High Priestess lied about! Damnit! This was useless!*
"So that's what that mark in your eyes does. Being framed isn't fun, you know?"
Selle uses a prepared spell, Expeditious Retreat. This is done through a quick verbal chant.

A figure leaps out from the shadows and destroys the lock on the cell with a single swipe of his sword. "Is that you, Yule?" Erik casually opens the now unlocked door to the cell. "Glad I don’t worship this stuck up goddess. Would’ve been inconvenient to justify."

((End session. Roll initiative next time))
